author: A_Brickset_user
title: A good set
review:
I give this set a six because it has the neat disk thrower and a glow in the dark disk,also I like the two tone color on the mask and the return of the old Bionicle head but in a dark gray.The only thing I don't like about the set is having to put a 2 axel in the slot that hooks the legs
the legs together and that does not leave much mobility.But other wise this is a fun set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Awesome
review:
I like to pretend that the Toa Metru are Knights because they have Midevil weapons (Vakama: crossbow Matau: swords
Nokama: bladed whips Nuju: bladed clubs Onewa: Grappling hooks Whenua: clubs) and that the "Metruan" are their squires, armed with mini crossbows. 
Nuhrii makes a great squire, what with his armor, weapons, and ability to help Vakama.
Well anyway, unfortunately he has no back, but it is made up for with the color and "heatness" lol

author: Gus_263
title: Great to play
review: This like the other matoran of metru nui, changing only in color. He have the same silver painting on the mask, and a armor as body, having nothing on back. The mask is a noble ruru well maded, with good quality. The disk launcher is silver and includes a ta-metru disk.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Neat little Matoran
review:
I got this yesterday from a friend who found him, along with Orkahm, in a garage sale.  They were both sealed in their boxes, but the boxes were severely crunched up.
When I built him, I was pleasantly surprised by his 'playability.' I thought the 2004 Matoran were rather stiff and not fun to pose, but this guy is neat!  Unlike Orkahm, Nuhrii's head matches his body perfectly.  Not that I don't like Orkahm or anything, it's just that his head kinda sticks out.  Anyway, another neat thing about Nuhrii is that there's a long pin on his back to hold the disk launcher on to his back.

Pros:

-Posable and playable

-Cool looking

-Disk launcher and disk

-Place to put the launcher and disk on his back

Cons:

-None

Altogether, 5/5, nice set.  If you get the chance, try and get him.

author: bajadogq
title: Nuhrii, the Ta-Matoran Mask Maker
review:
I noticed how there were only a few reviews on this little guy, so I had to write one. For starters, he's dark red and dark gray. His mask has bits of silver paint melding with dark read on it. He has a glow-in-the-dark disc and launcher (which really works!). A pin allows you to have him carry the launcher on his back. His ability to pose is okay, but limited.

Pros:
- Mask
- Overall Design
- Color Scheme
- Launcher

Cons:
- Limited posability

Overall this is a pretty well designed set.

author: Kopaka43
title: A pretty good set.
review: Nuhrii is my only '04 matoran set, and arrived in a Bionicle bulk lot from Ebay. I must say, I was very pleased with his pieces, coloration, etc. My only gripe about this little guy is that his neck is a bit too long. This can easily be fixed with a few pieces, though. All in all, a great set, and worth getting if you see him for a reasonable price.

author: tkettle9719
title: My first Matoran
review:
I received this set, along with the brown Matoran, on the Easter of 2004 from the bunny himself. The bunny has good taste in small Lego sets.

Pros

  • -The revival of the original Bionicle pre-mask is awesome.
  • -The Kanoka launcher is an amazing weapon, always.
  • …

Cons

  • -The model feels incomplete in the back, especially with the long connector peg.
  • -The mask also feels a bit incomplete at the top.
  • …

This Matoran is quite nice, and adds a nice little variety to canister sets in terms of size. This is recommended to all who collect mainly Bionicle canister sets.
